title.value: Characterizing the voxel-based approaches in radioembolization dosimetry with reDoseMC
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper and it reflects the primary focus of the study, which is the characterization of voxel-based dosimetry approaches using the developed software reDoseMC.
title.quote: Characterizing the voxel-based approaches in radioembolization dosimetry with reDoseMC

extractions.description: This paper focuses on the characterization of voxel-based dosimetry approaches in radioembolization by using a Geant4-based Monte Carlo software called reDoseMC. The study investigates the effect of voxel sizes, image resolutions, target volumes, and tissue materials on the accuracy of dosimetry techniques for radioisotopes Yttrium-90 and Holmium-166. It also emphasizes the importance of standardizing dosimetry protocols for better comparability.

type.justification: The paper is empirical because it involves experimentation using simulations and comparisons with published data to validate findings related to dosimetry in radioembolization.
type.quote: Methods: A specialized radiopharmaceutical dosimetry software called reDoseMC was developed using the Geant4 Monte Carlo toolkit and validated by benchmarking the generated ^{90} Y kernels with published data.

name.justification: The paper is centered on dosimetry, which is a core aspect of medical physics, particularly in the context of radiopharmaceutical therapies like radioembolization.
name.quote: The objective of this study was to expand upon these dosimetry characterizations...

name.justification: The study focuses on dosimetry calculations for radiopharmaceutical therapies using isotopes such as Yttrium-90 and Holmium-166, hence relating to the field of Radiopharmaceutical Dosimetry.
name.quote: Background: Yttrium-90 ( ^{90} Y) represents the primary radioisotope used in radioembolization procedures...

name.justification: The research implements Monte Carlo simulations using Geant4 to perform dosimetry calculations, making it relevant to the field of Monte Carlo Simulations.
name.quote: A specialized radiopharmaceutical dosimetry software called reDoseMC was developed using the Geant4 Monte Carlo toolkit...

name.justification: reDoseMC is the central model developed and validated in this study for dosimetry calculations.
name.quote: Conclusions: reDoseMC was developed and validated for radiopharmaceutical dosimetry.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents reDoseMC as a new contribution to the field of dosimetry by developing it specifically for this study.
is_contributed.quote: Methods: A specialized radiopharmaceutical dosimetry software called reDoseMC was developed...

is_executed.justification: reDoseMC was executed and validated during the study using Monte Carlo simulations.
is_executed.quote: A Geant4-based Monte Carlo software called reDoseMC was developed and validated...

is_compared.justification: While reDoseMC was validated with experimental data, the paper does not detail direct numerical comparisons with other models.
is_compared.quote: The reDoseMC Monte Carlo software comes equipped with a range of features, including multi-threading...

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference paper title for the model `reDoseMC` as it is a new contribution of this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Conclusions: reDoseMC was developed and validated for radiopharmaceutical dosimetry.

name.justification: Geant4 is explicitly mentioned as the toolkit used to develop the reDoseMC software for dosimetry simulations.
name.quote: The reDoseMC Monte Carlo software comes equipped with a range of features, including multi-threading or multi-cluster compatibility, precise radioactive source placement, and scoring of decay spectra.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to Geant4 is acknowledged by referencing its documentation or development papers.
